intro: Shirakiopsis virgata, commonly known as the white-flowered irkana, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its small, white, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
